page.title: 19Farms in Knowle
page.content: At Henwood Hall farm Mr Joyce the son of the farmer gave us alot of help and infomation. There is 90 acres of Wheat, Swede and Turnips. They have been taking up old turf and selling it because they are going to re-seed it. There is 30 acres of sheep grazing, they sell sheep for slaughtering. When the motorway was built the farm lost 15 acres of land, where cattle were kept and also lost a farm cottage. The family have lived on the farm for 19 years and Mr Joyce told us some of the history of the sight. The farm-house was built in 1840 but before that it had been a nunnery and a priory. The moat was a fish pond that burst its banks and now the river flows past. Once they had two sheep stolen they found wool on the top of the style but never found the sheep.
